docs.title: About
docs.text:
Hello! I'm Julia,

I’m a QA Test Engineer based in the UK, passionate about quality and delivering software products that make an impact on end-users. I've worked on educational projects where being responsible for their overall product quality.

FAVOURITE BOOKS

  • Effective DevOps - Jennifer Davis and Ryn Daniels
  • Leading Quality: How Great Leaders Deliver High-Quality Software and Accelerate Growth - Ronald Cummings-John & Owais Peer
  • A Practical Guide to Testing in DevOps - Katrina Clokie
  • Radical Candor - Kim Scott

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
I'm always happy to help in anything I can so if you'd like to get in touch with me, please use the links below.

  • Twitter
  • LinkedIn

docs.title: Portfolio juliatorrejon.com
docs.text: I started blogging as a way to keep a record of my learning path because I am a huge proponent of the fact that if you can write down your thoughts about a topic well enough, then you have sufficiently learnt the base level knowledge for that skill. It is a great way to reinforce what you have learnt.

docs.title: Bin Collection Day
docs.text: Find out your bin collection day and what bin needs to be collected. Get notified on your phone through a notification in order to remind you when is the bin collection day.

docs.title: Python Weather Map API
docs.text: A Python script which interact swith the OpenWeatherMap API to retrieve the current temperature for a city.

docs.title: Django Web Application
docs.text:
A small working Django web application: My own blog.

The objective is to create a blog with the ability to log in into the application with users' login details to be able to comment on the blog.

docs.title: MediaWiki Docker Compose
docs.text: Docker compose configuration launches a Mediawiki instance using MariaDB as a database.
